alert.note: Alert for Bertie; Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Gates; Hertford; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Bertie, eastern Gates, Currituck, Chowan, Camden, Pasquotank, Perquimans, and southeastern Hertford Counties, the City of Norfolk, the City of Chesapeake, the City of Hampton, the southern City of Newport News, the City of Portsmouth, the eastern City of Suffolk and the City of Virginia Beach through 715 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Norfolk NAS to 7 miles east of Williamston. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Newport News, Hampton, Currituck, Elizabeth City, Camden, Windsor, Hertford, Winfall, Elizabeth City State University, Ocean View, Ryland, Weeksville, Virginia Wesleyan University, Regent University, Great Bridge, South Mills, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth and Churchland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Bertie; Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Gates; Hertford; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
